          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class CustomForm extends React.Component {\nconstructor() {\n    super();\n    this.state = {\n        person: {\n            firstName: '',\n            lastName: ''\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nhandleChange(event) {\n    let person = this.state.person;\n    person[event.target.name] = event.target.value;\n    this.setState({person});\n}\n\nrender() {\n    return (\n        <form>\n            <input \n            type=\"text\"\n            name=\"firstName\"\n            value={this.state.firstName}\n            onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)} />\n\n            <input \n            type=\"text\"\n            name=\"lastName\"\n            value={this.state.lastName}\n            onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)} />\n        </form>\n    )\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }

                "In this example we initialize state with an empty person object. We then bind the values of the 2 inputs to the individual keys of the person object. Then as the user types, we capture each value in the "
              ],
              ["handleChange", [["c"]]],
              [
                " function. Since the values of the components are bound to state we can rerender as the user types by calling "
              ],
              ["setState()", [["c"]]],

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["person[event.target.name]", [["c"]]],
              [" is the same is a "],
              ["person.firstName || person.lastName", [["c"]]],
              [
                ". Of course this would depend on which input is currently being typed in. Since we don’t know where the user will be typing, using a dictionary and matching the input names to the names of the keys, allows us to capture the user input no matter where the onChange is being called from."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      }
    },
    "space": {}
  }
}
